title: Rugby World Cup 2019 rankings - part six: Doddie Weir's verdict on which quarter-finalists have the most destructive second-row combinations
text:
Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions. The sixth installment sees Doddie Weir deliver his verdict on which teams' second-row forwards are leading the charge.

This is in order of importance to the teams' success, how the players in these positions can influence games during the knockout stages of the tournament.

8. France

I can never shift the impression that Sebastien Vahaamahina is a bit of a liability, whether in terms of discipline or doing something daft like when he threw the intercept against Wales in the Six Nations. Bernard Le Roux seems more like a converted flanker, gets through a tonne of work but not tall or heavy...
description: Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions.
